TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
31 Vita sancti Pauli.
SEint powel was a luþer Man &punctelev; are he icouerted were
Alle þe cristine Men of þe lond &punctelev; hadden of him gret fere
For he was muche and strong and feol. &punctelev; &yogh;wareso he eni founde
In chaumbre ne in bedde he ne sparede nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he ne slov&yogh; heom alle to grounde
Þo he hadde aboute Ierusalem &punctelev; In eche stude isou&yogh;t
And alle þe cristine men þat he fond &punctelev; to stronge deþe ibrou&yogh;t
he cam to þe souereyns of þe lawe &punctelev; and seide, "ich habbe imad al clene
Al þis lond of cristine Men &punctelev; [&yogh;e][om.] ne dorre of heom more mene
Wende ichulle to Dam[a]sche &punctelev; and clansi þat lond also
Alle þat ich aliue finde mai &punctelev; to deþe ichulle heom do
Oþur ichulle heom faste binde &punctelev; and hidere to eov sende
Alle þat ich aliue finde may &punctelev; ichulle asle oþur schende."
¶ Saul was þo is ri&yogh;te name. &punctelev; he gan forth iwende
IArmed, and mani a man with him &punctelev; to bringe is þou&yogh;t to ende
Ase he cam amidri&yogh;t þe wei &punctelev; a li&yogh;t him cam aboute
Þat he ne mi&yogh;te for li&yogh;te iseon. &punctelev; þo gan him sore adoute
he stod ase þei he astoned were. &punctelev; þo cam þare in a stounde
A drem ase þei it a þondre were. &punctelev; þarewith he ful to grounde
And lai, þat he ne mi&yogh;te him wawie nou&yogh;t. &punctelev; þo herde he a uoiz telle
"Saul, &yogh;wi werrestþov opon me &punctelev; mine Men forto quelle?"
"ho art þov?" seide saul &punctelev; "louerd, artþov þare?"
A voiz seide, "&yogh;e, ich am þi god &punctelev; þat þov hast iweorred so &yogh;are
to wynci a&yogh;ein þe pricke &punctelev; swiþe strong it is þe."
"Louerd," seide Saul þo &punctelev; "&yogh;wat woltþov do mid me?"
"Þov schalt," seide ore louerd þo &punctelev; "Into þe toune wende
Þine ri&yogh;te bileue þe schal teche &punctelev; a man, to &yogh;wam ischal þe sende."
Þis was þene fourteoþe &yogh;er &punctelev; aftur þulke stounde
Þat Ihesu crist soffrede on þe rode &punctelev; for us deþes wounde.
Þo Saul hadde longe ileie &punctelev; wel softe he op aros
And stod opâ€”he ne mi&yogh;te iseo neuere a del &punctelev; ful sore him agros
he let him lede to þe toun. &punctelev; it was þane þridde dai
Are he .et. oþur dronk &punctelev; oþur ani si&yogh;t isai&yogh;
¶ Ore louerd cam to a guod preost &punctelev; is name was ananye
"go," he seide, "into þe toun &punctelev; and to Iudases hous þov hi&yogh;e
Saul þov schalt þare finde &punctelev; þat iweorred me hauez longue
&YOGH;if him cristindom in mine name &punctelev; and he it wole onderfonge
sei&yogh;e þat god þe þudere sende &punctelev; þat In þe weie a&yogh;ein him cam
Þo he wolde a&yogh;ein him weorri &punctelev; and is power him bi[bi overlined]nam."
'Louerd," seide Ananie &punctelev; "ich habbe muche iheord telle
Þat Saul was a luþer man &punctelev; and cristine men dude quelle."
"Ne dred þe nou&yogh;t," ore louerd seide &punctelev; "lomb he is bicome
him þinchez longe are he habbe &punctelev; cristinedom inome
to beo prechour of mi word &punctelev; ichose ich him habbe
he schal beo wis and studefast &punctelev; nanne betere inabbe."
Þo Ananie iheorde þis &punctelev; hardiliche forth he wende
he cam to Saule and seide him so &punctelev; þat ore louerd him þudere sende
Þat he scholde cristine beo. &punctelev; saul was þo wel bliþe
And er þane he ibaptized was &punctelev; ech &yogh;wyle him þou&yogh;te fiue
Þo he ibaptized was &punctelev; powel was is name
Wel au&yogh;ten men herien þane god &punctelev; þat of þe wilde makez þe tame
Anon so he Ibaptized was &punctelev; þare feol out of eiþer ei&yogh;e
Fuylþe ase þei it were slym &punctelev; þat alle þe men it sei&yogh;e
þo mi&yogh;te he swiþe wel iseo. &punctelev; he heold op is honde
¶ Aknevwes he sat in his bedes &punctelev; and þonkede godes sonde
tendre metes men greiþede him &punctelev; and &yogh;af him þarof wel ofte
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te is strencþe coueri &punctelev; heo beddeden him wel softe
Þo seint powel icouered was &punctelev; and hadde strencþe of Manne
he purueide him of prechingue &punctelev; and wende anon ri&yogh;t þanne
Into þe giwene synagogue &punctelev; and prechede cristindom
Ech man wondrede þat him isai&yogh; &punctelev; þo he prechour bicam
And seiden &punctelev; "nis þis þilke man &punctelev; þat weorrede alle þeo
In þe londe of Ierusalem &punctelev; þat he mi&yogh;te o&yogh;were cristine men Iseo?"
Manie Men he tornede to cristinedom &punctelev; and manie him þou&yogh;ten quelle
And bispeken hov heo mi&yogh;ten do &punctelev; for he bigan a&yogh;ein heom telle
he ne let for no drede &punctelev; þat he ne prechede wel bliue
For euere þoru ore louerdes grace &punctelev; he ascapede with þe liue
he sou&yogh;te &yogh;ware þe Apostles weren &punctelev; to heom he cam wel sone
to prechi mid heom godes word &punctelev; ase hore ri&yogh;te was to done
Þe apostles weren formest aferd of him &punctelev; and leueden him wel vnneþe
For he so muche cristine folk &punctelev; hadde ibrou&yogh;t to deþe
Ake þo heo wusten hou it was &punctelev; to felawe [heo] him toke
For þare ne iwerth non so wis &punctelev; holi churche to loke
Seint powel to cristinedom &punctelev; cam In þusse manere
god us graunti for is loue &punctelev; In heuene to ben is fere
